content.rendered:
The northern and one of the largest and most heavily populated states of Uttar Pradesh is an experience. Home to some of the magnificent holiday sightseeing places ranging from Taj mahal to Mathura Vrindavan, Allahabad, Varanasi, and more this place offers you the perfect solution for a wholesome holiday with your family and loved ones. The state shares its borders with a number of states like Chhattisgarh, Jharkhand, Delhi, and even Nepal among others. Due to this reason, the connectivity here has to be impeccable. Catering to a large crowd of travelers, explorers and visitors from all over the world who come for its spiritual and religious value UP is well prepared to deal with this influx. Although a developing state, it is very well connected through a range and network of highways, roads, railways, flights and many more. If you are thinking about planning a visit to one of the places this state has to offer then you will have a lot of options to choose from. There are 4 domestic and 2 international airports in the state to enable people to travel from anywhere they wish.

If you are planning a visit to this remarkable state then here is how you can reach UP:

By Air:

UP is visited by numerous travelers and visitors from all over the globe. To make traveling even more convenient for them there are 4 domestic and 2 international airports in UP. The domestic airports are located in Agra, Lucknow, Kanpur, and Varanasi. Lucknow is the capital of the state and is very well connected throughout the different cities and various neighboring cities as well like Delhi, Kolkata, Patna, Mumbai, etc. the international airports are located in Lucknow and Varanasi. There are several domestic flight operators who connect this state with the rest of the country. From the airport, travelers can easily hire a cab or a taxi service to your desired destination. Although one of the most convenient ways of traveling air travel may prove to be expensive, especially if you are a budget traveler.

By Train:

This is the only and the most pocket-friendly way of reaching UP no matter where you are traveling from. There are around 430 functional railway stations catering to people from all over the world to UP. Some of the biggest stations that function here are located in Allahabad, Kanpur, Varanasi, Meerut, Jhansi, Agra, etc. people living within UP who choose to work in Delhi or some other neighboring states decide to commute by train. The railway connection here is very finely interconnected and makes traveling possible. Some other railway station junctions in UP include Faizabad, Jhansi, Mughal Sarai, Tundla, Gorakhpur, Sitapur, etc. once the travelers reach one of these railway stations people can choose to go to their desired destination via a bus, taxi or cab service. Train service connects the rest of India very well with UP and is also a great way of traveling in a cheaper manner.

By Road:

UP is known for being connected very well with well made and smooth roads running across the city, connecting villages and towns. This makes the movement extremely easy not just for travelers but for the locals as well. it is well connected via a series of national highways and various district and private roads. What works best is opting for state-run and Volvo buses on a regular basis. It is one of the most pocket-friendly ways of traveling especially if you are planning a weekend getaway or a holiday from some nearby place like Delhi, Chandigarh, Chhattisgarh, etc. running on these roads are private cars, cabs, taxis, local buses, etc. road trip to UP will constitute for a wholesome travel experience with your family, friends and loved ones. People nowadays have even started to go on bike trips to various places in and around UP due to the good quality of roads which makes traveling not only easy but also an extremely very fun experience.

Being one of the most widely known states in India and filled with numerous gems of tourist interest, UP is very well connected through various networks and modes of travel as mentioned above. You can choose any way you wish to travel depending on your budget.
